And at the same time I considered that, with the Greeks undertaking, professing and achiev- ing such marvels, and promising to reveal to mankind the way to understand the profoundest mysteries. to live rightly and to speak copiously, it would be brutish and inhuman not to lend an ear, and, though perhaps not venturing to listen to them openly, for fear of lessening your influence with your fellow- citizens, yet to pick up their sayings by eavesdropping‚ and keep a look· out from afar for their talk. Accordingly I did so, Catulus, and took a little taste of the cases and actual types of all those friends of yours!
